item.title: 英国将延长电动汽车补贴以抵消预算案中的增税措施
item.description: 英国政府将增加对电动汽车的补贴，以缓解下周预算案中针对电动汽车的增税措施。【原文：The UK government will increase subsidies for electric vehicles as it seeks to mitigate a tax rise that’s expected to target the cars at next week’s budget.】

item.title: COP30 气候协议须知
item.description: 经过两周的洪水、火灾、抗议和咖啡助兴的深夜谈判，COP30 已落下帷幕。该协议缺乏雄心壮志，令许多国家感到沮丧。今天的时事通讯将介绍今年谈判的六大收获，以及世界在减排和适应更热地球方面的努力方向。【原文：After two weeks of flood, fire, protests and coffee-fueled late-night negotiations, COP30 has reached a close. The deal left many nations frustrated with its lack of ambition. Today’s newsletter covers the six key takeaways from this year’s talks and where it leaves the world in its efforts to cut emissions and adapt to a hotter planet.】

item.title: COP30 气候谈判的六大收获
item.description:
从化石燃料问题上的重大妥协到缔约方大会议程上的新项目，这就是您需要了解的今年的谈判— 以及接下来的内容。【原文：

From the grand compromise on fossil fuels to the new items on the COP agenda, this is what you need to know about this year’s negotiations — and what comes next.

】

item.title: COP30 峰会闭幕，各国同意加强气候计划
item.description: 近 200 个国家周六同意做出新的努力，以帮助指导它们摆脱导致全球变暖的化石燃料，同时也避免明确提及化石燃料。【原文：Nearly 200 nations agreed Saturday to new efforts meant to help guide their transitions away from the fossil fuels driving global warming, even while dodging an explicit mention of them.】

item.title: 谈判陷入僵局后，英国总统米利班德对达成 COP30 协议持 "乐观 "态度
item.description: 英国负责能源安全和净零排放问题的国务大臣埃德-米利班德（Ed Miliband）说，他对联合国气候协议的达成表示 "乐观"，该协议将加强应对全球变暖的雄心壮志，并促成更多摆脱化石燃料的具体计划。【原文：Ed Miliband, UK secretary of state for energy security and net zero, said he was “optimistic” that a United Nations climate deal was in reach that would strengthen ambition in the fight against global warming and lead to more concrete plans to transition away from fossil fuels.】

item.title: 混合种子如何帮助拯救本土森林
item.description:
在巴西，种子采集者在谋生的同时，还帮助恢复植被和应对气候变化。【原文：

In Brazil, seed collectors are helping restore vegetation and combat climate change while earning a living.

】

item.title: 外交官在联合国气候谈判中权衡化石燃料退出计划的休战问题
item.description: 周五晚些时候，国际气候谈判代表们正在权衡一项可能达成的妥协协议，即制定一项正式计划，以履行一项具有里程碑意义的长达两年之久的承诺，使世界能源系统不再使用化石燃料。【原文：International climate negotiators were weighing a potential compromise deal late Friday on establishing a formal plan for fulfilling a landmark two-year-old promise to shift the world’s energy system away from fossil fuels.】

item.title: 欧盟因 COP30 协议草案过于薄弱而拒绝接受，为超时会谈埋下伏笔
item.description: 今天是 COP30 的最后一天。但是，按照典型的缔约方大会方式，谈判似乎将进入加时赛，尤其是在周四会场发生火灾，扰乱了会议进程之后。【原文：It’s the last official day of COP30. But in classic COP fashion, negotiations look set to go into overtime, especially after a fire broke out in the venue on Thursday, disrupting proceedings.】

item.title: 瑞士在 COP30 会议上游说开展更多碳信用额交易
item.description: 随着传统气候援助的减少，此举将为发展中国家输送更多资金。【原文：Switzerland is rallying support for a new international effort to boost carbon-credit trading under an emerging United Nations-backed mechanism, a move that would channel more funds to developing countries as traditional climate aid wanes.】

item.title: 为什么中国没有填补美国退缩后的气候领导空白？
item.description:
世界头号排放国正在关注有利于北京的问题，同时帮助引导全球绿色议程。【原文：

The world’s top emitter is focusing on issues that benefit Beijing while helping steer a global green agenda.

】

item.title: 北极寒流侵袭法国和瑞士，阿尔卑斯山遭大雪袭击
item.description: 一股北极气流正笼罩着法国和瑞士，这是十多年来最强烈的十一月寒流，预计未来几天阿尔卑斯山将有大雪。【原文：A stream of Arctic air is gripping France and Switzerland in the most intense November cold snap in more than a decade, with heavy snow forecast for the Alps in the coming days.】

item.title: 巴西 COP30 气候协议草案忽略了退出化石燃料的计划
item.description: 巴西在周五凌晨向 COP30 气候峰会提交了一份协议，其中未提及任何退出化石燃料的内容，遭到了生产国的强烈抵制。【原文：Brazil presented the COP30 climate summit with a deal in the early hours of Friday that omitted any reference to exiting fossil fuels amid stiff resistance from producing countries.】

item.title: 日本最大核电站将获得事实上的重启批准
item.description: 据彭博社看到的文件显示，东京电力公司将于周五获得日本地方长官的批准，重启该国最大的核电站。【原文：Tokyo Electric Power Co. will receive approval from a local Japanese governor on Friday to restart the country’s biggest nuclear power plant, according to documents seen by Bloomberg.】

item.title: 越南咖啡区暴雨成灾，洪灾死亡人数攀升
item.description: 连日来的严重洪灾导致越南的死亡人数攀升至 43 人，因为暴雨淹没了中部高原的咖啡产区，一些旅游区的水位仍然很高。【原文：The death toll in Vietnam from days of severe flooding has climbed to 43 as heavy rain drenches coffee-producing regions in the central highlands and waters remain high in some tourism areas.】

item.title: 印度最富有家族推动孟买绿地建设
item.description:
滨海路花园是大城市由亿万富翁主导的最新重建项目。【原文：

The Coastal Road Garden is the latest billionaire-led redevelopment project in the megacity.

】

item.title: COP30 气候谈判在大火中走向圆满结束
item.description: 周四，在巴西举行的气候谈判充满了戏剧性和危险性。危险：会场发生火灾。戏剧性一份协议草案将删除关于停止使用化石燃料路线图的措辞，该路线图得到了 80 个国家的支持。 比喻：非常贴切。【原文：Drama and danger gripped climate talks in Brazil on Thursday. The danger: A fire broke out at the venue. The drama: A draft agreement is set to strike language about a road map to end fossil fuel use supported by 80 countries. The metaphors: very on the nose.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚敦促世界停止使用化石燃料，因为它自己也是努力的发起者
item.description:
古斯塔沃-佩特罗（Gustavo Petro）总统推动石油、天然气和煤炭退出市场，却遭遇了能源短缺。【原文：

President Gustavo Petro’s push to exit oil, gas and coal has collided with an energy shortage. 

】

item.title: 巴西准备达成 COP30 协议，但不会改变使用化石燃料的新方式
item.description: 主持联合国高级别气候会谈的巴西官员正在准备一项初步协议，该协议无视约 80 个国家提出的进一步制定摆脱化石燃料过渡计划的要求。【原文：Brazilian officials running high-level United Nations climate talks are readying a preliminary agreement that ignores demands from about 80 nations to further develop plans to transition away from fossil fuels.】

item.title: 特朗普能源部改组取消清洁能源办公室
item.description: 特朗普政府正在取消能源部专注于清洁能源和可再生能源的办公室，转而设立专门负责碳氢化合物和聚变能源的部门。【原文：The Trump administration is eliminating Energy Department offices focused on clean energy and renewables and, instead, creating units dedicated to hydrocarbons and fusion energy.】

item.title: 巴西 COP30 气候峰会会场发生火灾
item.description: 周四，在巴西贝伦举行的联合国气候峰会上，会场内突发大火，迫使数千名代表在谈判进入最后几个小时时慌忙撤离。【原文：A fire erupted inside the packed United Nations climate summit in Belém, Brazil, on Thursday, forcing a panicked evacuation of thousands of delegates just as negotiations reached their final hours.】

item.title: 比尔-盖茨因淡化气候风险遭岛国斥责
item.description: 最容易受到全球变暖破坏的国家谴责比尔-盖茨最近发表的备忘录，批评 "气候变化的末日观点"。【原文：Nations among the most vulnerable to the damage wrought by global warming have decried the recent memo by Bill Gates criticizing a “doomsday view of climate change.”】

item.title: 下一轮气候谈判将在土耳其举行
item.description: 至少有一项重要决定在 COP30 会议上尘埃落定。在就谁将主办明年的气候谈判进行了一场 "胆小鬼 "游戏之后，土耳其战胜了澳大利亚。不过，澳大利亚仍将扮演一定的角色，今天的新闻简报将为您详细解读。建议：现在就预订酒店。【原文：Well, at least one important decision has been squared away at COP30. After a game of chicken over who would host next year’s climate talks, Turkey has prevailed over Australia. The latter will still have a role, though, and today’s newsletter breaks down how things will work. Protip: Book your hotel now.】

item.title: 欧洲对资产管理公司的环境、社会和治理规则进行重大改革
item.description: 欧盟委员会公布了对投资行业《环境、社会和公司治理规则》的重大改写，标志着旨在帮助提高集团竞争力的根本性改革迈出了最新一步。【原文：The European Commission unveiled a significant rewrite of its ESG rulebook for the investment industry, marking the latest step in a fundamental overhaul designed to help improve competitiveness in the bloc.】

item.title: 加利福尼亚州的记录显示纽森声称的气候领导地位
item.description:
随着美国在气候政策上的退缩，州长正在将自己塑造成全球领导者。【原文：

As the US retreats on climate policy, the governor is pitching himself as a global leader. 

】

item.title: 欧洲寒流考验数千台新型热泵
item.description:
波兰是欧洲最依赖煤炭的国家之一，在试图到 2030 年将可再生能源发电能力提高两倍的过程中，波兰正在转向使用热泵。【原文：

Poland, one of Europe’s most coal-dependent nations, is pivoting to heat pumps as it attempts to triple its renewables capacity by 2030.

】

item.title: 阿尔-戈尔说化石燃料公司正在破坏民主和环境的稳定
item.description:
这位美国前副总统认为，我们可以更快地应对气候变化，并希望招募更多的人来帮助解决这一问题。【原文：

The former US vice president thinks we can be moving much faster on climate change and wants to recruit more people to help tackle the problem.

】

item.title: 日本核监察机构揭露东电核电站文件处理不当
item.description: 据日本原子能监察机构称，东京电力公司的一名员工在日本最大的核电站误操作了机密安全文件，这是该核电站即将获得批准重启的最新一起安全漏洞事件。【原文：A Tokyo Electric Power Co. employee mishandled confidential security documents at Japan’s biggest nuclear power plant, according to the nation’s atomic watchdog, in the latest security breach to affect a facility that’s close to getting approval to restart.】

item.title: 越南顶级咖啡种植区暴雨威胁作物生长
item.description: 大雨导致越南最大的咖啡种植省份达乐（Dak Lak）的收割工作延迟，而进一步的倾盆大雨则有可能破坏作物，并影响这个世界上最大的罗布斯塔咖啡豆生产国的产量。【原文：Heavy rain has delayed harvesting in Vietnam’s biggest coffee-growing province of Dak Lak, and further downpours risk damaging crops and crimping output in the world’s top producer of robusta beans.】

item.title: 中国碳价因金属和水泥行业的加入而跳涨
item.description: 在中国政府宣布将钢铁、铝和水泥行业纳入碳减排计划后，中国的碳价格飙升。【原文：China’s carbon prices surged after the government announced the implementation of a plan to include the steel, aluminum and cement sectors.】

item.title: 成本激增，日本计划加强对海上风电的支持
item.description: 日本政府计划扩大对海上风电项目的公共支持，因为成本迅速增加，威胁到该国的可再生能源目标。【原文：Japan’s government plans to expand public support for offshore wind power projects as costs increase rapidly and threaten the nation’s renewable energy goals.】
